content.title: Brachiocephalic Arteriovenous Fistula
content.definition: A surgically created arteriovenous fistula connecting the brachial artery to the cephalic vein at or above the antecubital fossa, used for hemodialysis access.

concepts.definition: When to create a brachiocephalic fistula.

clinical_features.failed_wrist: After failed or unsuitable radiocephalic fistula
clinical_features.preference: Some centers use as primary access in elderly/diabetic

clinical_features.artery: Brachial artery at or above antecubital fossa
clinical_features.anastomosis: Side of artery to end of vein, 4-6mm arteriotomy
clinical_features.nerve: Lateral antebrachial cutaneous nerve at risk

clinical_features.incision: Transverse or longitudinal at antecubital fossa
clinical_features.swing_point: May need to swing vein for optimal orientation

clinical_features.aneurysm: Cannulation site aneurysms with prolonged use

content.statement: Brachiocephalic Arteriovenous Fistula is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
